node.text:
Model and actor Tsubasa Honda, performer Mari Natsuki and professional surfer Shino Matsuda with the latest editions of the Hammock bag.
 
See more on loewe.com
 
Film directed by Yu Nakajima
Music by Shun Ishiwaka
 
モデル/俳優の本田翼、プロサーファー松田詩野とパフォーマー夏木マリと映る最新のハンモックバッグ。
 
#LOEWE #LOEWEhammock @tsubasa_0627official @mari_natsuki @shinomatsuda @yuislay @shun_ishiwaka

node.text:
Creative director @Jonathan.Anderson introduces the latest LOEWE collection and this season’s presentation concept.
 
Set to Love and Happiness 2021 by @KindnessMusic—a custom reworking of the original by River Ocean, inspired by the collection.
 
Directed by @StephenIsaacWilson @PulseFilms
Styling by @BenjaminBruno_
Casting by @AshleyBrokaw
Production by @HolmesProduction
 
Set design by @VincentOlivieri_
Movement Direction @Nicolas_Huchard
Hair & Make-up with thanks to the teams of @GuidoPalau and @PatMcGrathReal
Featuring Nick Coutsier (@nickcoutsier), Mcdaniel Obadiaru (@mcdaniel_18), Lulio Kambe (@iulio_kmb) and Sasha Desmaizieres (@sachadesm)
 
#LOEWE #LOEWESS22

node.text:
Ahead of @Sothebys marquee spring auctions of Impressionist, Modern and Contemporary Art in New York, LOEWE creative director @Jonathan.Anderson shares his thoughts on the importance of craft, art and design in the modern world.
 
Seven chestnut roasters from our new LOEWE Weaves series are currently offered for purchase through the Sotheby's Buy Now marketplace, and selected chestnut roasters are currently on display at the auction house's New York galleries.
 
#LOEWE #LOEWEprojects #SothebysBuyNow

node.title: Jonathan Anderson: The Dialogue Between Art & Design

node.text:
A visit to the workshop of Spanish straw artist @JavierSanchezMedina, who has handcrafted a series of animal head sculptures for the LOEWE Paula's Ibiza store concept. 
 
Made from esparto, a fibre produced from grasses native to southern Europe, the series reflects the natural, craft-led vibe of the collection and traditional Ibizan interiors.
 
Find out more on loewe.com
 
#LOEWE #LOEWEpaulas

For the LOEWE Spring Summer 2021 men's runway collection, basketweave artist @Idoia_Cuesta created commissioned pieces in leather. We revisit this conversation with Idoia whose studio we visited in Galicia.
 
Film direction @beatriz.vilarino
 
#LOEWE #LOEWESS21

node.text:
Artist and Director Ayo Akingbade's film on Anthea Hamilton (@HamiltonAnthea), the British artist who created the wallpaper 'Sr Jeanne Wavy Boots w. Gazanias and Snails', 2020 for the LOEWE Spring Summer 2021 women's collection.
 
One of four artists shortlisted for the 2016 Turner Prize, Anthea Hamilton is known for creating visually playful and surreal artworks and large-scale installations.
 
On camera, art historian and commentator Dr James Fox, known for presenting art history documentaries on the BBC, discusses life and art with Anthea Hamilton. Filmed in her studio in Stockwell, London, at Margate's Open School East where she is the artist-in-residence and at Thomas Dane Gallery in London who represent Anthea.
 
Director: Ayo Akingbade
Featuring: Anthea Hamilton interviewed by Dr James Fox
With thanks to @OpenSchoolEast
and @ThomasDaneGallery
 
#LOEWE #LOEWESS21 #AntheaHamilton #AyoAkingbade

node.title: ‘Akimbo Stylee’ — a documentary on Anthea Hamilton

node.text:
Dan Levy in bespoke LOEWE at the 2021 Met Gala.

The look features two seminal works by artist and LGBTQ activist David Wojnarowicz (1954-1992), crafted with the brief of imagining what a “gay superhero” might wear.

The LOEWE bespoke polo and trousers depicts two men kissing, from a 1984 artwork that deftly reappropriates a homophobic cartoon to instead celebrate same-sex love. Photos of Wojnarowicz and his friends surround the couple, amid a background of world maps, indicating the arbitrary borders and divisions the queer community faced.

The LOEWE T-Pouch clutch illustrates a portrait of the artist as a child, with surrounding texts predicting his future; deemed an outcast by society, as a gay man. The work asserts visibility for queer people—exposing the hatred and bias experienced daily, while celebrating love and joy.

To honour the collaboration, LOEWE has made a donation to Visual AIDS, an organization Wojnarowicz supported, that continues to promote AIDS awareness and education.

Styling by Erica Cloud

Artwork Credits:
David Wojnarowicz (1954–1992)
Fuck You Faggot Fucker, 1984
Untitled (One Day This Kid...), 1990–91
Courtesy the Estate of David Wojnarowicz and PPOW Gallery
PPOW Gallery represents the Estate of David Wojnarowicz

#LOEWE 
#DavidWojnarowicz 
#METgala
